item.title: Rigid contact
item.description: rigid contact in equations of motion can be inforced by a single quadratic equality constraint and two linear inequality constraint \[\begin{aligned} \bm{ϕ}(\bm{q})⋅\bm{f} &= 0 \\ \bm{\phi}(\bm{q}) &≥ 0 \\ \bm{f} &≥ 0 \end{aligned}\] which can be written in the compact form of an LSP as \[\operatornamewithlimits{find}_{\bm{f}} \ \text{s.t.}: 0 ≤ \bm{ϕ}(\bm{q}) ⟂ \bm{f} ≥ 0\] Example # Take a simple cart Its equations of motion can be written as \[m\ddot{q} = u + f\] suplemented by contact constraints \[ fq = 0 \;,\quad q ≥ 0 \;,\quad f ≥ 0\] written in the compact form of an LSP as \[\operatornamewithlimits{find}_{f} \ \text{s.

item.title: Coulomb friction
item.description: In the case of Coulomb friction there are two general cases for the friction force \( f \) \[f = \begin{cases} \dot{q} = 0 : |f| < μmg \\ \dot{q} \neq 0 : |f| = μmg \end{cases}\] where \( mg \) is always the magnitude of the normal force and \( μ \) the coefficient of friction. This can be written in the very compact condition \[0 ≤ μ mg - |f| ⟂ \dot{q}\] By introducing slack variables \( f^+ \) , \( f^- \) where \( f = f^+ - f^- \) and \( v_\text{abs} = |\dot{q}| \) we may convert the condition into an LCP \[\operatornamewithlimits{find}_{v_\text{abs},f^+,f^-} \ \text{s.
